etymology.description: 木(木) (mù, "tree") + additional stroke = accentuates the root -> "root"
etymology.interpretation: The character 本(本) (běn, "root") emphasizes the base or origin of a tree by highlighting its root with an additional stroke. This visual representation helps convey the idea of 'root' or 'foundation.'

examples.chinese: 我们必须找到问题的本(我們必須找到問題的本)，然后对症下药(然後對症下藥)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen bìxū zhǎodào wèntí de běn, ránhòu duìzhèng xiàyào.
examples.english: We must find the root of the problem, then prescribe the remedy accordingly.

examples.chinese: 医生不仅治标(醫生不僅治標)，更注重治本(更注重治本)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng bújǐn zhìbiāo, gèng zhùzhòng zhìběn.
examples.english: Doctors not only address the symptoms, but also focus on treating the root cause.

examples.chinese: 他试图探明这种现象的本(他試圖探明這種現象的本)，以便找到解决方案(以便找到解決方案)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shìtú tànmíng zhè zhǒng xiànxiàng de běn, yǐbiàn zhǎodào jiějué fāng'àn.
examples.english: He tried to ascertain the root of this phenomenon in order to find a solution.
